protocol_name: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
protocol_name_html: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
before_start:
Please wear at least the minimum required personal protective equipment.

Ensure that all necessary kit components are available as well as user-supplied consumables.

Clean all working surfaces, pipettes, and pens to remove DNA contamination.
warning:
Please wear gloves at all times.

 

Please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for hazard information.
protocol_affiliation: UC San Diego,National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
manuscript_citation: Marotz, Clarisse, et al. "DNA extraction for streamlined metagenomics of diverse environmental samples." BioTechniques 62.6 (2017): 290-293.

compare_forks.protocol_name: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
compare_forks.protocol_name_html: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol

authors: Lisa Marotz1,Tara Schwartz,Luke Thompson,Greg Humphrey,Grant Gogul,James Gaffney,Amnon Amir,Rob Knight
guidelines:
QIAGEN® MagAttract® PowerSoil® DNA KF Kit (384) (Optimized for KingFisher)

 

The Knight lab has transitioned to the QIAGEN® MagAttract® PowerSoil® DNA KF Kit (384) (Optimized for KingFisher). We have validated a variety of sample types to ensure reproducibility when compared to MoBio PowerSoil Extraction Kit. This transition occurred to increase efficiency and reduce DNA extraction time from 6-8 hours to 3-4 hours.

 

The protocol is followed as QIAGEN® recommends, with an added 10-minute water bath incubation at 65°C after the Lysis buffer addition, and retention of the 10-minute incubation at 4°C after lysate addition to IR Solution.

 

The new kit can be implemented on the epMotion using a magnetic bead plate adapter for the epMotion. However, it does not reduce the amount of time the extraction takes by a significant amount: tests showed that the new kit on the epMotion took longer than the old kit. Comparison showed both the old and new kit performed well on the epMotion.

 

QIAGEN® MagAttract® PowerSoil® DNA KF Kit (384)

 

The QIAGEN® DNeasy® PowerSoil® Kit (formerly: MoBio PowerSoil DNA Isolation Kit; QIAGEN® catologue: 12888-100) is still used if KingFisher instrumentation is not available, or if the sample set contains less than 48 samples.

 

Items included in the extraction kit (for one 96 well extraction)

  • (1) Bead plate
  • (2) 1.0ml collection plates
  • Sealing Tape
  • Labeled solutions

 

Important Considerations 

 

  1. Normal diameter 1 ml pipet tips are too large for some of the pipetting steps. To get around this problem we use a Rainin™ 1000 ul 8-channel pipette with extended length filtered tips (Rainin™ RT-LTS-A-1000µL-/F/X-768/8, catologue: 30389223).
  2. Make sure that all of the necessary consumables and reagents are in place before you start the extraction. Remember, each pipetting step will require 1 box of 96 tips per plate.
  3. We use presterilized reservoirs for pipetting steps carried out by epMotion® liquid handlers.
  4. When setting up the mechanical lysis, it is important that the plate not rub against any surfaces of/in the plate shaker.
  5. Make sure that the alpha-numeric grid is in the same orientation across all the plates.


Next Steps

  • 16S rRNA Amplification Protocol
  • 18S rRNA Amplification Protocol
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Plating Samples
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the PowerBead® DNA Plate (Bead Plate) from the QIAGEN® MagAttract® PowerSoil® DNA KF Kit (384), and centrifuge for 1 minute at 2500 x g to pellet the garnet beads prior to sample addition.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the PowerBead® DNA Plate (Bead Plate) from the QIAGEN® MagAttract® PowerSoil® DNA KF Kit (384), and centrifuge for 1 minute at 2500 x g to pellet the garnet beads prior to sample addition.

components.data: Sample Lysis
components.name: Section

components.data:
Remove excess water from the Bead Plate(s), and make sure that all wells are still fully sealed.

Place the Bead Plate(s) between two Adapter Plates (QIAGEN® catalogue: 11990) and securely fasten to a 96-well Plate Shaker (such as, QIAGEN® TissueLyser® II; QIAGEN® catalogue: 85300).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove excess water from the Bead Plate(s), and make sure that all wells are still fully sealed.

Place the Bead Plate(s) between two Adapter Plates (QIAGEN® catalogue: 11990) and securely fasten to a 96-well Plate Shaker (such as, QIAGEN® TissueLyser® II; QIAGEN® catalogue: 85300).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 14 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name_html: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: Most Plate Shakers are designed to process two plates at once. If this is the case, it is important to balance the Plate Shaker. If working with two Bead Plates, simply attach each Bead Plate to a station on the Plate Shaker. If you only have one Bead Plate to affix to the Plate Shaker, attach the sample-containing Bead Plate to one station, and a spare/empty PowerBead® DNA Plate to the second station as a balance.
source_data.thread_text: Most Plate Shakers are designed to process two plates at once. If this is the case, it is important to balance the Plate Shaker. If working with two Bead Plates, simply attach each Bead Plate to a station on the Plate Shaker. If you only have one Bead Plate to affix to the Plate Shaker, attach the sample-containing Bead Plate to one station, and a spare/empty PowerBead® DNA Plate to the second station as a balance.
source_data.body: Most Plate Shakers are designed to process two plates at once. If this is the case, it is important to balance the Plate Shaker. If working with two Bead Plates, simply attach each Bead Plate to a station on the Plate Shaker. If you only have one Bead Plate to affix to the Plate Shaker, attach the sample-containing Bead Plate to one station, and a spare/empty PowerBead® DNA Plate to the second station as a balance.

components.data: Sample Lysis
components.name: Section

components.data:
Centrifuge Bead Plate(s) at room temperature for 6 minutes at 3220 x g (or 4500 x g depending on centrifuge).

While centrifuging, or during Bead Plate shaking, add 450 μl IR Solution (Inhibitor Removal Technology® Solution) to each well of a clean/empty Collection Plate (1 ml) (provided in kit), and cover with clear Sealing Tape (provided in kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Centrifuge Bead Plate(s) at room temperature for 6 minutes at 3220 x g (or 4500 x g depending on centrifuge).

While centrifuging, or during Bead Plate shaking, add 450 μl IR Solution (Inhibitor Removal Technology® Solution) to each well of a clean/empty Collection Plate (1 ml) (provided in kit), and cover with clear Sealing Tape (provided in kit).

source_data.title: IR Solution to clean Collection Plate

components.data: Lysate Transfer and Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the lysate-containing Bead Plate(s) from the centrifuge, and carefully remove and discard the Square Well Mat.

components.data: Lysate Transfer and Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data:
Remove the Sealing Tape from the IR Solution-containing Collection Plate.

Transfer 640 μl, or less, lysate from each well of the Bead Plate to the Collection Plate, and mix gently by pipetting up and down 4 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove the Sealing Tape from the IR Solution-containing Collection Plate.

Transfer 640 μl, or less, lysate from each well of the Bead Plate to the Collection Plate, and mix gently by pipetting up and down 4 times.

source_data.title: Bead Plate lysate to IR-Collection Plate

components.data:

Incubate Collection Plate(s) at 4°C for 10 minutes.

components.data: Lysate Transfer and Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the Sealing Tape from Collection Plate(s) #2, and transfer 450 μl of supernatant to a clean KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate. Transfer the remaining supernatant, 400 μl, to a second KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate. Discard Collection Plate(s) #2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the Sealing Tape from Collection Plate(s) #2, and transfer 450 μl of supernatant to a clean KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate. Transfer the remaining supernatant, 400 μl, to a second KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate. Discard Collection Plate(s) #2.

components.data: Loading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Loading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System

components.data: Initiate the 'KF_Flex_MoBio_PowerMag_Soil_DNA' program on the KingFisher™ Flex™ robot. Ensure that the protocol is set to utilize both sample lysate aliquots.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Initiate the 'KF_Flex_MoBio_PowerMag_Soil_DNA' program on the KingFisher™ Flex™ robot. Ensure that the protocol is set to utilize both sample lysate aliquots.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 27 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name_html: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation:
Depending on the version of BindIt™ Software operating on the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System, the "KF_Flex_MoBio_PowerMag_Soil_DNA" script may need to be downloaded and transferred to the KingFisher™ Flex™ machine. 

Currently, the robotic script for the MagAttract® PowerSoil® DNA KF Kit can be found by visiting the following site, opening the SDS/Protocols tab, and selecting the "KingFisher Flex" option under the "Robotic Scripts" header: 

https://mobio.com/products/dna-isolation/soil/powermag-soil-dna-isolation-kit.html
source_data.thread_text:

source_data.annotation: If using two aliquots of the sample lysate for purification, as in this EMP protocol, add an additional sample binding step after the first (before the first wash step) in the BindIt™ Software, and transfer the modified protocol to the robotic platform.

components.data: ClearMag® Reagent Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data: For each 96 well plate processed, suspend 2 ml ClearMag® Zorb Reagent in 45 ml of ClearMag® Binding Solution in a clean reservoir. Pipette up and down thoroughly to evenly disperse the magnetic beads in solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For each 96 well plate processed, suspend 2 ml ClearMag® Zorb Reagent in 45 ml of ClearMag® Binding Solution in a clean reservoir. Pipette up and down thoroughly to evenly disperse the magnetic beads in solution.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 6 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name_html: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: If stopping, use the Square Well Mat to reseal the loaded Bead Plate, and store at -20°C until ready to proceed. It is important to note the orientation that the Square Well Mat has been placed back on top of the sample-containing Bead Plate. This is easiest done by using a laboratory grade permanent marker, such as VWR® Lab Marker (VWR® catalogue: 52877-310), to write directly on the Square Well Mat denoting where well A1 is.
source_data.thread_text: If stopping, use the Square Well Mat to reseal the loaded Bead Plate, and store at -20°C until ready to proceed. It is important to note the orientation that the Square Well Mat has been placed back on top of the sample-containing Bead Plate. This is easiest done by using a laboratory grade permanent marker, such as VWR® Lab Marker (VWR® catalogue: 52877-310), to write directly on the Square Well Mat denoting where well A1 is.
source_data.body: If stopping, use the Square Well Mat to reseal the loaded Bead Plate, and store at -20°C until ready to proceed. It is important to note the orientation that the Square Well Mat has been placed back on top of the sample-containing Bead Plate. This is easiest done by using a laboratory grade permanent marker, such as VWR® Lab Marker (VWR® catalogue: 52877-310), to write directly on the Square Well Mat denoting where well A1 is.

components.data: Sample Lysis
components.name: Section

components.data: In a sterile reservoir, add 400 μl RNase A Solution to 75 ml of PowerBead® Solution (Bead Solution) for every 96-well plate that will be processed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In a sterile reservoir, add 400 μl RNase A Solution to 75 ml of PowerBead® Solution (Bead Solution) for every 96-well plate that will be processed.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 9 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.protocol_name_html: Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) high throughput (HTP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation:
PowerBead® Solution contains guanidinium thiocyanate (CAS: 593-84-0, less than 10% w/w); handle this reagent with care, and dispose of as hazardous chemical waste in accordance with all institutional and local regulations. 

 

RNase A Solution is also a hazardous chemical mixture (ribonuclease, CAS: 9001-99-4, less than 10% w/w), and should be disposed of properly. 

 

RNase A Solution is stable for approximately 1 year at room temperature, 25°C. For longer storage, it is recommended that you store the RNase A Solution at 2°-8°C. The Knight Lab at UC San Diego currently uses this solution at room temperature.
source_data.thread_text:
PowerBead® Solution contains guanidinium thiocyanate (CAS: 593-84-0, less than 10% w/w); handle this reagent with care, and dispose of as hazardous chemical waste in accordance with all institutional and local regulations. 

 

RNase A Solution is also a hazardous chemical mixture (ribonuclease, CAS: 9001-99-4, less than 10% w/w), and should be disposed of properly. 

 

RNase A Solution is stable for approximately 1 year at room temperature, 25°C. For longer storage, it is recommended that you store the RNase A Solution at 2°-8°C. The Knight Lab at UC San Diego currently uses this solution at room temperature.
source_data.body:
PowerBead® Solution contains guanidinium thiocyanate (CAS: 593-84-0, less than 10% w/w); handle this reagent with care, and dispose of as hazardous chemical waste in accordance with all institutional and local regulations. 

 

RNase A Solution is also a hazardous chemical mixture (ribonuclease, CAS: 9001-99-4, less than 10% w/w), and should be disposed of properly. 

 

RNase A Solution is stable for approximately 1 year at room temperature, 25°C. For longer storage, it is recommended that you store the RNase A Solution at 2°-8°C. The Knight Lab at UC San Diego currently uses this solution at room temperature.

components.data: Plating Samples
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove nuclease and nucleotide contamination from work surfaces and instruments prior to starting using an appropriate solution, such as RNase AWAY™ (Thermo Scientific™ catalogue: 700511), followed by wiping with 70% to 100% molecular biology grade ethanol to remove additional contaminants.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove nuclease and nucleotide contamination from work surfaces and instruments prior to starting using an appropriate solution, such as RNase AWAY™ (Thermo Scientific™ catalogue: 700511), followed by wiping with 70% to 100% molecular biology grade ethanol to remove additional contaminants.

source_data.annotation: This is the way that all surface and instrument, other than the KingFisher™ Flex (follow manufacturer documentation), cleaning steps are carried out for EMP KingFisher™ HTP gDNA extractions by the Knight Lab at University of California San Diego.

components.data: Sample Lysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Clean all work surfaces and instruments with RNase AWAY™ reagent (Thermo Scientific™ catalogue: 700511), wipe dry, and repeat with 70%-100% ethanol, wipe dry. Turn on a water bath to 65°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Clean all work surfaces and instruments with RNase AWAY™ reagent (Thermo Scientific™ catalogue: 700511), wipe dry, and repeat with 70%-100% ethanol, wipe dry. Turn on a water bath to 65°C.

components.data: Sufficiently clean the work surface and a multichannel pipette that is capable of transfering volumes up to 1000 μl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sufficiently clean the work surface and a multichannel pipette that is capable of transfering volumes up to 1000 μl.

components.data: For each 96 well plate processed, aliquot 500 μl ClearMag® Wash Solution to each well of 3 clean KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plates, and 100 μl Solution EB, Elution buffer, to each well of 1 clean KingFisher™ 96 KF Microtiter (200 μl) Plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For each 96 well plate processed, aliquot 500 μl ClearMag® Wash Solution to each well of 3 clean KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plates, and 100 μl Solution EB, Elution buffer, to each well of 1 clean KingFisher™ 96 KF Microtiter (200 μl) Plate.

components.data: ClearMag® Reagent Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data: For each 96 well plate processed, add 47 ml of ClearMag® Binding Solution to a separate, clean, reservoir.

components.data: ClearMag® Reagent Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 470 μl ClearMag® Zorb Reagent/ClearMag® Binding Solution to each well of one sample lysate containing KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 470 μl ClearMag® Zorb Reagent/ClearMag® Binding Solution to each well of one sample lysate containing KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate.

components.data: ClearMag® Reagent Aliquoting
components.name: Section

components.data: To the remaining KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate(s) containing lysate, add 470 μl ClearMag® Binding Solution to each well.

source_data.description: To the remaining KingFisher™ Deep Well 96 Plate(s) containing lysate, add 470 μl ClearMag® Binding Solution to each well.

components.data: Loading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Loading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System

components.data: Follow the onscreen prompts to properly load the KingFisher™ Flex™. The loading order should be: the tip comb, elution plate, ClearMag® Wash Solution filled plates, lysate with ClearMag® Binding Solution plate (Bind 2), and lysate containing ClearMag® Binding Solution/ClearMag® Zorb Reagent plate (Bind1).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Follow the onscreen prompts to properly load the KingFisher™ Flex™. The loading order should be: the tip comb, elution plate, ClearMag® Wash Solution filled plates, lysate with ClearMag® Binding Solution plate (Bind 2), and lysate containing ClearMag® Binding Solution/ClearMag® Zorb Reagent plate (Bind1).

components.data: Running the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Running the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System

components.data: The selected KingFisher™ Flex™ program will execute itself once the final plate is added and "Start" is pressed. The program takes approximately 65 minutes to complete, and requires no user intervention.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The selected KingFisher™ Flex™ program will execute itself once the final plate is added and "Start" is pressed. The program takes approximately 65 minutes to complete, and requires no user intervention.

components.data: Unloading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Unloading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System

components.data: When the KingFisher™ Flex™ program finishes, remove the gDNA containing elution plate, and seal this with an appropriate storage seal (not Sealing Tape from kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When the KingFisher™ Flex™ program finishes, remove the gDNA containing elution plate, and seal this with an appropriate storage seal (not Sealing Tape from kit).

components.data: Unloading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Unloading the KingFisher™ Flex™ Purification System

components.data:
Follow the onscreen prompts to cycle through each station on the KingFisher™ Flex™ deck.

Dispose of all liquids from plates as hazardous chemical waste (the gDNA elution plate should already be removed and appropriately sealed), and discard the emptied plates. The gDNA is now ready for downstream applications.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Follow the onscreen prompts to cycle through each station on the KingFisher™ Flex™ deck.

Dispose of all liquids from plates as hazardous chemical waste (the gDNA elution plate should already be removed and appropriately sealed), and discard the emptied plates. The gDNA is now ready for downstream applications.
